question: What are clinical features of the Achard-Thiers syndrome?
ideal_answer: Achard-Thiers is associated with simultaneous existence of overt diabetes and marked hirsutism. Obesity, hypertension and angiopathy are also common.

snippets.text: Diabetes in bearded women (Achard-Thiers-Syndrome) : A clinical and metabolic study of 20 cases.

Twenty patients, selected on the basis of simultaneous existence of overt diabetes and marked hirsutism, were submitted to clinical and biological investigations. Obesity, hypertension and angiopathy were present in most of these patients.
